metadata.title: Dafon CV - Create your Perfect CV with AI
metadata.description: Transform your professional experience into unique and personalized CVs. Our AI adapts your CV to each job, maximizing your chances of success.

hero.headline: Create your Perfect CV with AI
hero.subheadline: Transform your professional experience into unique and personalized CVs. Our AI adapts your CV to each job, maximizing your chances of success.

personalTip.description: A good personal introduction shows your personality and humanizes your profile. Talk about your passions, hobbies that demonstrate relevant qualities, values that motivate you and what inspires you. Be authentic and show what makes you unique!

banner.title: We use cookies to improve your experience
banner.description: We use cookies and similar technologies to help personalize content, provide and improve our services, and analyze traffic. By clicking "Accept All", you consent to the use of cookies for all purposes. You can customize your preferences in our cookie settings.

settings.title: Cookie Settings
settings.description: Manage your cookie preferences to control how we use your data

necessary.title: Necessary Cookies
necessary.description: These cookies are essential for the proper functioning of the site. They cannot be disabled.

analytics.title: Analytics Cookies
analytics.description: These cookies help us understand how visitors interact with our site by collecting and reporting information anonymously.

marketing.title: Marketing Cookies
marketing.description: These cookies are used to track visitors across websites to display relevant and engaging advertisements.

functional.title: Functional Cookies
functional.description: These cookies enable enhanced functionality and personalization, such as remembering your preferences.

privacy.title: Your Privacy Matters
privacy.description: We respect your privacy and are committed to protecting your personal data. You can change these settings at any time. For more information, please read our Privacy Policy and Terms of Use.

section1.title: 1. Service Provider Information and Service Overview

subsection1.title: 1.1. Provider Information
subsection1.content: The Service is provided by Daniel Fonseca da Silva, an independent worker in Portugal. For questions related to these Terms, please contact us at dafondeveloper@gmail.com.

subsection2.title: 1.2. Service Description
subsection2.content: DafonCV provides automated services for creating resumes and analyzing existing resumes, through the provision of personal information. Our Service creates customized resumes, and delivers analyses and resumes via files such as PDF and other formats.
subsection2.aiDisclosure: AI Processing Disclosure: Our Service uses artificial intelligence systems, including Claude AI and ChatGPT, to analyze, filter, and enhance resume and job market information through automated content triage and context expansion. Users may be notified that they are interacting with AI-powered systems that process and recommend job opportunities based on algorithmic analysis.

section2.title: 2. Acceptance and Modification of Terms
section2.content: By accessing or using our Service, you acknowledge that you have read, understood, and agree to be bound by these Terms and our Privacy Policy. These Terms constitute a legally binding agreement between you and the Service Provider under the laws of the Portuguese Republic and applicable European Union Regulations, including, but not limited to, GDPR. We reserve the right to modify these Terms at any time. Changes will be published on our website with an updated effective date. Continued use of the Service after changes constitutes acceptance of the modified Terms. Your electronic acceptance of these Terms creates a valid and enforceable contract in accordance with Portuguese law and European Union electronic contract formation requirements, including the eIDAS Regulation (Regulation (EU) No. 910/2014).

subsection1.title: 3.1. Age Eligibility
subsection1.content: Our Service is available to all users on the planet. However, for users in the European Union, the user must be of the minimum legal age to enter into binding contracts (generally 18 years, or the age determined by Portuguese law or the law of the consumer's country of residence, if applicable), and comply with the Terms registered here and local laws governing their use of communication platforms and automated services.

subsection2.title: 3.2. Account Registration
subsection2.content: To use the Service, users must create an account by providing accurate and up-to-date information. Users are responsible for maintaining the confidentiality of their access credentials and for all activities that occur under their account.

subsection1.content: Users agree to use the Service only for lawful purposes and in accordance with these Terms. It is prohibited to use the Service for any illegal, fraudulent activity or that violates the rights of third parties.

subsection2.content: Users may not attempt to access unauthorized areas of the Service, interfere with the operation of the Service, or use any automated method to access the Service without prior authorization.

section5.title: 5. Subscription System and Tokens
section5.intro: We offer services through purchases based on subscription plans. Users can subscribe to plans for continuous access.

subsection1.title: 5.1. Payment Processing
subsection1.content: All payments are processed securely through Stripe, a third-party payment processor. When making purchases, you agree to comply with Stripe's Terms of Service and acknowledge that your payment information will be processed in accordance with their security standards and our Privacy Policy.

subsection2.title: 5.2. European Right of Withdrawal (Right of Withdrawal)
subsection2.content: Standard Right: European residents (including in Portugal) acting as consumers have the right to withdraw (cancel) any online purchase within 14 days from the date of conclusion of the subscription contract, and receive a full refund, under the terms of Directive 2011/83/EU on Consumer Rights. Exception for Digital Services: The user acknowledges and accepts that they lose their 14-day withdrawal right if the provision of the service (immediate access and resume creation) is started immediately after purchase with their express consent and acknowledgment that, by doing so, they lose the right of withdrawal. If the Service is fully executed at the user's request during the 14-day period, the right of withdrawal also ceases.

subsection3.title: 5.3. Billing and Subscription Cancellation
subsection3.content: Subscriptions are automatically renewed at the end of each billing period. We will provide at least 30 days' notice for subscription price increases. Users can cancel subscriptions at any time through account settings or by contacting support. Cancellation will take effect at the end of the current billing period.

subsection1.title: 6.1. Provider Property
subsection1.content: The Service, including software, algorithms, trademarks, and content (excluding user data and publicly available information about job opportunities), is the property of the Service Provider and protected under Portuguese and international intellectual property laws.

subsection2.title: 6.2. Limited License to User
subsection2.content: We grant users a limited, non-exclusive, and non-transferable license to access and use the Service strictly for personal and non-commercial purposes of creating and analyzing resumes, during the term of their subscription.

subsection3.title: 6.3. Third-Party Information and Data Ownership
subsection3.content: We aggregate publicly available information from job sites. We respect the intellectual property rights of third parties and do not claim ownership of job opportunities or third-party images. Users retain full ownership of any data and content (including personal information, work history, and text) that they provide to the Service for resume creation. By using the Service, users grant us a worldwide, non-exclusive, royalty-free, sublicensable, and transferable license to process, format, store, and display their information only to the extent necessary for Service delivery (i.e., to generate and analyze the resume and recommendations).

subsection1.content: The processing of users' personal data is governed by our Privacy Policy, which complies with the European Union's General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) and Portuguese data protection laws.

subsection2.content: Users have the right to access, rectify, delete, limit processing, data portability, and object to the processing of their personal data, as provided for in the GDPR.

subsection1.content: The Service uses cookies and similar technologies in compliance with the ePrivacy Directive (2002/58/EC) and GDPR. For more information about cookie use, please see our Privacy Policy.

subsection2.content: Users can manage their cookie preferences through browser settings or our website's cookie settings.

section9.title: 9. Legal Compliance and Privacy Policy
section9.content: For the global operation of the Service, users' personal data may be transferred to countries outside the European Economic Area (EEA), including the USA and United Kingdom. Any international transfers are subject to appropriate safeguards, in accordance with Article 46 of the GDPR, and will be protected through the implementation of Standard Contractual Clauses (SCCs) approved by the European Commission, or other valid transfer mechanisms, ensuring that data maintains a level of protection essentially equivalent to that guaranteed by the GDPR.

subsection1.content: Users agree to indemnify, defend, and hold harmless the Service Provider from any claims, damages, losses, liabilities, and expenses (including attorney's fees) arising from the user's use of the Service, violation of these Terms, or violation of any third-party rights.

section11.title: 11. Limitation of Liability and Warranty Exclusions

subsection1.title: 11.1. Warranty Disclaimer ("As Is")
subsection1.content: The Service is provided "as is" and "as available" without warranties of any kind, express or implied, including, but not limited to warranties of accuracy, reliability, fitness for a particular purpose, or non-infringement. Information about job opportunities is aggregated from third-party sources and may be incomplete, outdated, or inaccurate. Users should independently verify all information. We are not responsible for decisions made based on Service data.

subsection2.title: 11.2. Limitation of Liability
subsection2.content: To the maximum extent permitted by applicable law, the total liability of the Service Provider for all claims related to the Service shall not exceed the amounts paid by the user in the 12 months prior to the claim. This limitation applies regardless of the legal theory on which the claim is based.

subsection3.title: 11.3. Exclusion of Indirect Damages
subsection3.content: We will not be liable for indirect, incidental, special, consequential, or punitive damages, including, but not limited to lost profits, business interruption, or loss of business opportunities, unless such damages result from intentional misconduct or gross negligence on our part.

subsection4.title: 11.4. Non-Excludable Liability (EU/Portugal Law Compliance)
subsection4.content: Nothing in these Terms limits or excludes our liability for: Death or Personal Injury resulting from our negligence; Fraud or fraudulent misrepresentation; or Any other liability that cannot be limited or excluded under the laws of the Portuguese Republic or applicable European Union laws.

subsection1.content: The Service Provider reserves the right to suspend or terminate the user's access to the Service, at any time, without prior notice, for violation of these Terms or for any other reason at the Service Provider's discretion.

subsection2.content: The user may terminate their account at any time through account settings or by contacting support.

subsection1.content: The Service Provider reserves the right to modify, suspend, or discontinue any aspect of the Service at any time, with or without prior notice.

subsection2.content: The Service Provider will not be liable to the user or any third party for any modification, suspension, or discontinuation of the Service.

subsection1.title: 14.1. Applicable Law
subsection1.content: These Terms are governed and interpreted in accordance with the laws of the Portuguese Republic and applicable European Union laws (including EU consumer protection regulations), without regard to their conflict of law principles.

subsection2.title: 14.2. Jurisdiction (Forum)
subsection2.content: Any dispute, controversy, or claim arising from or in connection with these Terms, or their violation, resolution, or invalidity, shall be submitted to the jurisdiction of Portuguese courts, with the court in the Service Provider's area of residence being competent, or, at the consumer's choice, the court in the area of their residence, under Regulation (EU) No. 1215/2012.

subsection3.title: 14.3. EU Consumer Rights
subsection3.content: Notwithstanding Clause 14.2, if the user acts as a consumer and resides in another member state of the European Union, the Applicable Law and jurisdiction will be governed by EU consumer protection rules, which allow the consumer to bring an action in the courts of their country of residence.

subsection4.title: 14.4. EU Alternative Dispute Resolution (ADR)
subsection4.content: Consumers in Portugal and other EU member states may seek dispute resolution through the European Commission's Online Dispute Resolution (ODR) platform, accessible at https://ec.europa.eu/consumers/odr/. Portuguese consumers may also resort to the Consumer Conflict Arbitration Center. The parties agree to attempt good faith negotiation before initiating formal legal proceedings.

subsection1.title: 15.1. Agreement Integrity
subsection1.content: These Terms, together with the Privacy Policy, constitute the complete agreement between the user and the Service Provider regarding the use of the Service and supersede all prior agreements.

subsection2.title: 15.2. Severability
subsection2.content: If any provision of these Terms is found to be invalid or unenforceable, the remaining provisions will remain in full force and effect.

subsection3.title: 15.3. Prevailing Language
subsection3.content: The Portuguese or English version of these Terms will prevail in case of conflicts with translations.

subsection4.title: 15.4. Waiver
subsection4.content: The Service Provider's failure to enforce any right or provision of these Terms will not constitute a waiver of such right or provision.

subsection5.title: 15.5. Assignment
subsection5.content: The user may not assign or transfer these Terms or any rights granted herein without the prior written consent of the Service Provider. The Service Provider may assign these Terms without restrictions.

subsection6.title: 15.6. Contact
subsection6.content: For questions related to these Terms, please contact us at dafondeveloper@gmail.com.

section1.title: 1. Introduction and Scope
section1.content: DafonCV ("Service") is operated by Dafon LLC ("Company", "we", "our" or "us") and respects your privacy and is committed to protecting your personal information. This Privacy Policy explains how we collect, use, process, and protect information when you use the DafonCV service ("Service").
section1.complianceContent: This policy complies with the Brazilian General Data Protection Law (LGPD), European GDPR, US state privacy laws including the California Consumer Privacy Act (CCPA), Canada's Personal Information Protection and Electronic Documents Act (PIPEDA), the UK's Personal Information Protection and Electronic Documents Act, and applicable international data protection regulations.
section1.serviceOverviewContent: Our Service provides automated discovery of charts and European job market levels through AI-powered analysis of publicly available job listings from European sources, delivered via available format models.

section2.title: 2. Data Controller Information and Contact Details

section3.title: 3. Categories of Personal Information We Collect

subsection1.title: Information You Provide Directly:
subsection1.accountInfo: Account Information: Email address, notification preference settings, user preferences
subsection1.paymentInfo: Payment Information: Billing details processed through Stripe (we do not store complete payment card information)
subsection1.communicationData: Communication Data: Support inquiries, feedback, and correspondence

subsection2.title: Information Collected Automatically:
subsection2.usageData: Usage Data: Service interaction patterns, feature usage, search queries, and preferences
subsection2.technicalInfo: Technical Information: IP addresses, device information, browser type, access times
subsection2.botInteraction: Bot Interaction Data: Commands used, response patterns, service configuration choices
subsection2.sessionInfo: Session Information: Login timestamps, session duration
subsection2.profileData: Profile Data: Name, email, phone, career information, gender (when voluntarily provided by the user)

subsection3.title: Marketing and Analytics Data:
subsection3.siteAnalysis: Site Analytics: Google Analytics, Facebook Pixel, Yahoo marketing pixels for site optimization
subsection3.marketingAttribution: Marketing Attribution: Campaign effectiveness, referral sources, user acquisition metrics
subsection3.cookieData: Cookie Data: Session management cookies, preference settings, authentication tokens

section4.title: 4. Legal Basis for Processing and Purposes of Use

subsection1.title: LGPD Legal Bases:
subsection1.consent: Consent: For marketing communications, analytics, and optional features, and processing of sensitive data (when applicable)
subsection1.contract: Contract Performance: For service delivery, payment processing, and account management
subsection1.legitimateInterest: Legitimate Interest: For service improvement, fraud prevention, and customer support
subsection1.legalCompliance: Legal Compliance: For tax obligations, regulatory reporting, and law enforcement requests

subsection2.title: GDPR Legal Bases (for EU users):
subsection2.consent: Consent (Article 6(1)(a)): Marketing, analytics, and optional data processing
subsection2.contract: Contract Performance (Article 6(1)(b)): Service delivery and payment processing
subsection2.legitimateInterests: Legitimate Interests (Article 6(1)(f)): Service improvement, security, and fraud prevention
subsection2.legalObligation: Legal Obligation (Article 6(1)(c)): Regulatory compliance and legal requirements
subsection2.sensitiveData: Sensitive Data (Article 9): When sensitive data such as gender is processed, we base it on explicit consent from the data subject

subsection3.title: Processing Purposes:
subsection3.serviceDelivery: Service Delivery: Providing job opportunity notifications and personalized recommendations
subsection3.aiProcessing: AI Processing: Use of Claude AI and ChatGPT for content analysis, filtering, and document generation
subsection3.paymentProcessing: Payment Processing: Subscription management and billing through Stripe
subsection3.customerSupport: Customer Support: Responding to inquiries, troubleshooting, and service assistance
subsection3.serviceImprovement: Service Improvement: Analyzing usage patterns to enhance features and functionality
subsection3.marketingAnalysis: Marketing and Analytics: Understanding user behavior and promoting relevant services
subsection3.legalCompliance: Legal Compliance: Meeting tax, regulatory, and law enforcement obligations

section5.title: 5. AI Processing and Automated Decision Making

subsection1.title: AI Systems Used:
subsection1.contentAnalysis: Content Analysis: Processing resume information for relevance and quality
subsection1.jobScoring: Job Scoring: Algorithmic evaluation of listing value and user relevance
subsection1.contextExpansion: Automatic Context Expansion: Enhancing resume information with additional relevant details
subsection1.recommendationGeneration: Recommendation Generation: Personalizing job suggestions based on user preferences

subsection2.title: Automated Decision Making Rights:
subsection2.humanReview: Request human review of AI-driven recommendations
subsection2.understandLogic: Understand the logic behind automated processing that affects your service experience
subsection2.optOut: Opt out of using certain AI-powered features while maintaining access to the main service
subsection2.accessInfo: Access information about how AI systems process your data

section5.transparency: AI Transparency: AI processing involves analysis of user preferences, search history, and interaction patterns to improve recommendation accuracy. Users may request detailed explanations of AI decision-making processes that affect their service experience.

section6.title: 6. Data Sharing and Third-Party Processors

subsection1.title: Payment Processing:
subsection1.content: Stripe: Processes all payment transactions. Shared data includes billing information and transaction details. Stripe maintains independent privacy practices described in its privacy policy.

subsection2.title: Service Infrastructure:
subsection2.content: Cloud Hosting Providers: Service technical data and user information stored in secure cloud infrastructure

subsection3.title: AI Processing Partners:
subsection3.content: Anthropic (Claude AI): User queries and job market data processed for analysis and recommendations. OpenAI (ChatGPT): Similar processing for content enhancement and user assistance.

subsection4.title: Marketing and Analytics:
subsection4.googleAnalytics: Google Analytics: Site usage analysis for service improvement
subsection4.facebookPixel: Facebook Pixel: Marketing attribution and campaign optimization
subsection4.yahooAnalytics: Yahoo Analytics: Additional marketing performance analysis

section6.noDataSale: No Data Sale: We do not sell personal information to third parties for their direct marketing purposes.

section7.title: 7. International Data Transfers

subsection1.title: Transfer Locations:
subsection1.usa: United States: For AI processing (Anthropic, OpenAI) and payment processing (Stripe)
subsection1.eu: European Union: For cloud infrastructure and service delivery
subsection1.other: Other Countries: As necessary for service operation and third-party processing

subsection2.title: Transfer Safeguards:
subsection2.sccs: Standard Contractual Clauses (SCCs): We use Standard Contractual Clauses approved by the European Commission for EU data transfers, and clauses approved by ANPD for transfers from Brazil
subsection2.dataProcessing: Data Processing Agreements: Comprehensive agreements with all international processors that include data protection obligations
subsection2.privacyShield: Privacy Shield Successors: Appropriate frameworks for US data transfers when available
subsection2.adequateProtection: Adequate Protection: Ensuring that recipient countries provide adequate levels of data protection equivalent to EU and Brazil standards

section7.userRights: User Rights Regarding Transfers: Users may request information about international transfers affecting their data and the safeguards protecting their information in foreign jurisdictions.

subsection1.title: Retention Periods:
subsection1.accountData: Account Data: Retained while the account is active plus 30 days after closure
subsection1.paymentInfo: Payment Information: 7 years for tax and financial record keeping (European/international requirements)
subsection1.usageAnalysis: Usage Analysis: 24 months for service improvement analysis
subsection1.marketingData: Marketing Data: Until consent is withdrawn or maximum 3 years
subsection1.legalCompliance: Legal Compliance Data: As required by applicable laws and regulations

subsection2.title: Automatic Deletion:
subsection2.content: We implement automated deletion processes to remove data after retention periods end. Users receive notification before automatic deletion when required by law. We collect and retain only data necessary for specified purposes and regularly review retention practices to minimize storage duration.

subsection1.title: Universal Rights (Available to All Users):
subsection1.informed: Right to be Informed: Clear information about data processing at collection
subsection1.access: Right of Access: Obtain copies of personal data and processing information
subsection1.rectification: Right of Rectification: Correct inaccurate or incomplete information
subsection1.deletion: Right of Deletion: Request erasure of personal data ("right to be forgotten")
subsection1.portability: Right to Data Portability: Export data in machine-readable format
subsection1.opposition: Right of Opposition: Object to processing for direct marketing and legitimate interests

subsection2.title: Brazilian Users (LGPD Rights):
subsection2.confirmation: Right of Confirmation: Confirm existence of data processing
subsection2.information: Right of Information: Detailed information about processing activities
subsection2.anonymization: Right of Anonymization: Request anonymization of unnecessary data
subsection2.withdrawConsent: Right to Withdraw Consent: Easy mechanism for consent withdrawal
subsection2.explanation: Right of Explanation: Understand automated decision-making processes

subsection3.title: US State Law Rights (California, Virginia, Colorado, etc.):
subsection3.know: Right to Know: Categories of personal information collected and processed
subsection3.delete: Right to Delete: Request deletion of personal information
subsection3.optOut: Right to Opt-Out: Opt out of sale/sharing and targeted advertising
subsection3.nonDiscrimination: Right to Non-Discrimination: Equal service regardless of privacy choices
subsection3.correct: Right to Correct: Rectify inaccurate personal information

subsection4.title: Canadian Users (PIPEDA Rights):
subsection4.access: Right of Access: Access personal information maintained by the organization
subsection4.contest: Right to Contest: Contest accuracy and completeness of information
subsection4.withdrawConsent: Right to Withdraw Consent: Withdraw consent subject to contractual restrictions
subsection4.complain: Right to Complain: File complaints with the Privacy Commissioner

subsection1.title: How to Submit Requests:
subsection1.content: Email: dafondeveloper@gmail.com with "Privacy Request" in the subject line

subsection2.title: Request Processing:
subsection2.identityVerification: Identity Verification: Reasonable measures to confirm requester identity
subsection2.noFee: No Fee: Generally free unless requests are excessive or repetitive
subsection2.statusUpdates: Status Updates: Regular communication about request processing status

subsection3.title: Request Fulfillment:
subsection3.dataAccess: Data Access: Comprehensive information about data processing
subsection3.dataDeletion: Data Deletion: Complete erasure subject to legal retention requirements
subsection3.dataPortability: Data Portability: Machine-readable format (JSON, CSV, XML)
subsection3.consentWithdrawal: Consent Withdrawal: Immediate cessation of consent-based processing

subsection1.title: Types of Cookies Used:
subsection1.essential: Essential Cookies: Necessary for basic service functionality and security
subsection1.analytics: Analytics Cookies: Google Analytics for site performance analysis
subsection1.marketing: Marketing Cookies: Facebook Pixel, Yahoo marketing pixels for campaign optimization
subsection1.preference: Preference Cookies: Remember user settings and preferences

subsection2.title: Cookie Consent:
subsection2.granularControl: Granular Control: Users can accept/reject specific cookie categories
subsection2.consentManagement: Consent Management: Easy-to-use cookie preferences center
subsection2.withdrawalRights: Withdrawal Rights: Simple mechanism to withdraw cookie consent
subsection2.equalProminence: Equal Prominence: Accept and reject options receive equal emphasis

subsection3.title: Opt-Out Mechanisms:
subsection3.gpc: Global Privacy Control (GPC): Respect browser-based opt-out signals
subsection3.cookieSettings: Cookie Settings: Preference management accessible on all pages
subsection3.marketingOptOut: Marketing Opt-Out: Direct opt-out links in marketing communications
subsection3.analyticsOptOut: Analytics Opt-Out: Support for Google Analytics browser opt-out plugin

subsection1.title: Security Measures:
subsection1.encryption: Encryption: AES-256 encryption for data at rest, TLS 1.3 for data in transit
subsection1.accessControls: Access Controls: Role-based access permissions and multi-factor authentication
subsection1.regularAudits: Regular Audits: Periodic security assessments and penetration testing
subsection1.employeeTraining: Employee Training: Comprehensive privacy and security training programs

subsection2.title: Breach Response:
subsection2.detection: Detection: 24/7 monitoring and incident detection systems
subsection2.assessment: Assessment: Rapid risk assessment and impact analysis
subsection2.notification: Notification: Regulatory notification within 72 hours (GDPR), 3 business days (LGPD)
subsection2.userCommunication: User Communication: Immediate notification if breach likely to cause harm
subsection2.remediation: Remediation: Immediate measures to contain and remediate security incidents

subsection3.title: Data Protection Measures:
subsection3.privacyByDesign: Privacy by Design: Privacy protections integrated into system architecture
subsection3.dataMinimization: Data Minimization: Collect only information necessary for specified purposes
subsection3.regularDeletion: Regular Deletion: Automated removal of data after retention periods
subsection3.vendorSecurity: Vendor Security: Comprehensive security requirements for all data processors

section13.title: 13. Children's Privacy
section13.content: Although our Service is available to all users, we do not knowingly collect personal information from children under 13 years of age without parental consent in compliance with COPPA (Children's Online Privacy Protection Act).
section13.parentsCan: If we become aware that we have collected information from children under 13, parents may:
section13.requestAccess: Request access to their children's information
section13.requestDeletion: Request deletion of their children's personal information
section13.refuseCollection: Refuse additional collection of their children's information
section13.enhancedProtections: Enhanced Protections: Users aged 13 to 16 in EU jurisdictions receive enhanced privacy protections under GDPR requirements.

subsection1.title: Marketing Communications:
subsection1.explicitConsent: Explicit Consent: Opt-in for marketing communications
subsection1.serviceRelationship: Service Relationship: Transactional messages related to service use
subsection1.legitimateInterest: Legitimate Interest: Service improvement communications when permitted

subsection2.title: Communication Controls:
subsection2.subscriptionManagement: Subscription Management: Easy unsubscribe links in all marketing emails
subsection2.granularPreferences: Granular Preferences: Choose specific types of communications to receive
subsection2.immediateEffect: Immediate Effect: Opt-out requests processed within 10 business days

section15.title: 15. Updates to this Privacy Policy
section15.siteNotice: Site Notice: Prominent publication of updated policy with effective date
section15.emailNotification: Email Notification: Direct communication to registered users
section15.serviceNotification: Service Notification: In-app notices for significant changes
section15.reviewPeriod: Users have 30 days to review changes before they take effect. Continued use after the effective date constitutes acceptance of updated terms.

section16.title: 16. Contact Information and Complaints

subsection1.title: Privacy Inquiries:
subsection1.emailValue: dafondeveloper@gmail.com with "Privacy Request" in the subject line

subsection2.title: Regulatory Complaints:
subsection2.brazil: Brazil (LGPD): National Data Protection Authority (ANPD) - www.gov.br/anpd
subsection2.eu: EU (GDPR): Relevant EU supervisory authority in your member state
subsection2.canada: Canada (PIPEDA): Office of the Privacy Commissioner of Canada - priv.gc.ca

section16.commitment: We are committed to resolving privacy concerns promptly and encourage users to contact us directly before filing regulatory complaints. We maintain detailed records of complaint resolution efforts to demonstrate compliance with applicable privacy laws.
section16.compliance: This Privacy Policy complies with Brazilian LGPD, US state privacy laws, Canadian PIPEDA, EU GDPR, and international data protection standards. Regular updates ensure ongoing compliance with evolving regulatory requirements.

Contact.subtitle: Still have questions? We're here to help you.
